facts: The Sun contains about 99.8% of all the mass in our solar system.
A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus because it rotates very slowly.
Jupiter is so big that more than 1,300 Earths could fit inside it by volume.
Light from the Moon takes a little over one second to reach Earth.
Neutron stars are so dense that a teaspoon of their material would weigh billions of tons on Earth.
The Milky Way galaxy is so large that it takes light about 100,000 years to travel across it.
Astronauts in space can grow a little taller because their spines stretch in microgravity.
